column4: Hi, ive got an issue with international characters. I just installed, and i get my chars in gnome-terminal, but if i ssh to another box, i cant type them. Any ideas ?
the remote host probably doesn't have the correct $TERM and/or locales generated
it doesnt have UTF8, is that needed on the remote host for this to work ?
it does have that, works from every other box ive tried, and even from windows using putty
so it feels like the problem is local
what's $TERM in putty and using g-t?
what happens is when i type the norwegian chars, i can backspace past the prompt..
and in irssi etc they look really weird :)
is irssi configured to use UTF-8?
not remotely, but i figured it out, added 8859-10 to gnome-term,  that worked
